coordinates.lng: Arts and fine crafts abundance at the 10th Anniversary Paradise Studio Tour, Public invited free to visit artists in their home studios in Hawaiian Paradise Park. Seven studios with 25 local artists showing oil painting, watercolors, collage, pastels, acrylic, cement, wood sculpture, jewelry making, pottery, ceramics, silk painting, fashion art, gourd crafting, photography and more. Free featured demos. For brochure and map go to: www.paradisestudiotour.com or call (808) 982-5150.

coordinates.lat: Meet at Volcano Art Center’s Niaulani Campus in Volcano Village (corner of Kalanikoa and Old Volcano Roads).
coordinates.lng: "Niaulani Nature Walk" - Free Forest Tour in Volcano. This one-hour nature walk travels through a lush portion of an old-growth Hawaiian rain forest on an easy, 1/7-mile loop trail. The walk introduces individuals, families, and groups to the native plants and birds of Volcano. Guides focus not only on the biological, ecological, and geological features of the area, but also the cultural usages of flora and fauna by native Hawaiians. Offered every Monday at 9:30 a.m., the weekly walk starts just one mile from the entrance to Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park. Meet at Volcano Art Center’s Niaulani Campus in Volcano Village (corner of Kalanikoa and Old Volcano Roads). Free (calabash donations welcome). Call (808) 967-8222.

description: Duplicate Bridge Classes, Lunch and Games (Kona)

coordinates.lat: The Bridge Building at Hualalai Academy, 74-4966 Kealaka‘a Street, Kailua-Kona.
coordinates.lng: The Kona Bridge Club provides Duplicate Bridge lessons followed by lunch and an American Contract Bridge League (ACBL) sanctioned game.  The lessons follow the ACBL Bridge Club series and are currently using Defense in the 21st Century.  Classes are structured through use of lectures with pre-dealt hands and exercises illustrating the lectures.  The game has a session for beginners as well as intermediate players.  Reservations for the classes and lunch are recommended:  Call Sue Brown--808-375-6821 or email stbrown808@gmail.com

description: Free testing for HIV and Hepatitis "C" (Keaau)

coordinates.lat: Hawaii Island HIV/AIDS Foundation Office, Kea'au Shipman Industrial Park, 16-204 Melekahiwa Pl. Ste1
coordinates.lng:
We will be offering FREE HIV testing as well as Hepatitis "C" testing every week.
It consists of a pin prick of blood and 20 minutes of your private and confidential time.
Free gift for first 5 people testing each night!
Both of these diseases have no visible symptoms and can be passed unknowingly to others!
contact us at; 808.982.8800 for more information.

coordinates.lat: Meeting are held at the Kona Airport in the CAP Building Across from Air Cargo.
coordinates.lng:
The Kona CAP Squadron meets Tuesday Evenings 6pm to 8pm for Cadets ages 12-18 as well as adult senior members.

Meeting are held at the Kona Airport in the CAP Building Across from Air Cargo.

Contact 1Lt Myrick at capkona@gmail.com or phone 808-329-5312.

coordinates.lat: Corner of Kamehameha Avenue and Mamo Street, Hilo, HI
coordinates.lng: Local produce, fresh fish, flowers, plants, baked goods and box lunches. Local arts and crafts. 7 a.m.-3 p.m. every Wednesday and Saturday. Corner of Kamehameha Ave. & Mamo Street. Keith, 933-1000.

coordinates.lat: The Kings' Shops, Waikoloa Beach Resort
coordinates.lng: Promote our local farmers, creators of local food products and chefs!  We sell only locally farmed fruit, veggies, and orchids. Fresh locally produced specialty food items such as jam, coffee, tea, baked goods, kettlecorn and more are offered each Wednesday 8:30 - 1:00. Some vendors linger into the late afternoon. Contact Tammy Touchet at 895 8787 for more information.

coordinates.lat: Sheraton Kona Resort & Spa at Keauhou Bay
coordinates.lng: Ho`oulu Community Farmers' Market is an ongoing Wednesday event featuring fresh locally grown produce, art, hand made crafts and delicious foods.

Farmer's Market featuring all local products made and produced on the Big Island.
Including: Organic fruit and vegetables, orchids, coffee, bread, jewelry, aprons, massage, chiropractor, prepared food. 

Contact Person: Cindy Beckey, 775-9549

This rowdy bunch of whipper snapper young people will meet at Kona Stories to eat popcorn and discuss books.  Shop owner Joy reads out loud to these rascals and leads a very lively discussion on the book.  January’s discussion will be on “The Lightning Thief”…Riordan’s tale of troubled teenager Percy Jackson.  Read it before the movie hits in February.  This exciting book has a little time travel, a little Greek mythology and a lot of spunk.  This book club is free and open to all young at heart…but especially appropriate for 8 – 12 year olds.  For more information 324-0350.

Wainaku Wednesday is held at the Wainaku Executive Center located on 12 acres of Oceanfront property. We have live entertainment, Pupus from Cafe Pesto and Popup shops. Entry is free! Call 808-365-5380 or email tammy@olsontrust.com

coordinates.lat: Hawaii Tech Exchange, 259 Haili Street, Hilo, HI 96720
coordinates.lng:
Two hours devoted simply to writing. Bring a mug and laptop/notebook. We’ll provide coffee, tea, internet and the company of other writers.  All writers welcome; novelists, poets, scriptwriters, bloggers, etc.

Check the Hawaii Tech Exchange events page to make sure there is a meeting happening. http://hitx.co/events/

description: Sweet, White and Whole Wheat Bread Baking (Kona)

coordinates.lng:
Bread Baking at the Portuguese Stone Oven

Every Thursday between 10:00AM-1:00PM & (starting March 8th) Every 2nd Tuesday of the month

Starting March 8th, KHS will be baking Cinnamon and Country(crusty loaf and plenty of garlic) bread the second Tuesday of every month, as well as the traditional Sweet, White and Whole Wheat every Thursday!

The Kona Historical Society’s Portuguese Stone Oven is a reproduction of a typical oven used by the Portuguese immigrants who came to Kona in the 1880’s.  Join the process of panning the dough and baking 96 loaves every Thursday (and special Tuesdays) between 10:00am-1:00pm. The program is FREE and the bread is $7 per loaf.  Bring your lunch and make a day of it with an oven-side picnic in the pasture.  We hope to see you at the Portuguese Stone Oven in the pasture below KHS headquarters in Kealakekua.

Mamalahoa Hwy (Hwy 11) between mile markers 111 and 112 on the makai side of the road. (808) 323-3222
www.konahistorical.org

coordinates.lat: The Cooper Center, 19-4030 Wright Road, Volcano, HI 96785
coordinates.lng:
Our delicious and free community dinner is every Thursday from 4 - 6 pm. Come join us ... to eat, help, socialize, and/or donate dollars or food. A multi-course meal fit for all palates is always in the making ... and for those in need there are also take home package goods (on the final Thursday of each month).

Everyone is welcome to enjoy, and we always need more dishwashers after if you have the time!

Info: http://www.thecoopercenter.org

Kanikapila with Uncle Willie at the Kona International Market every Friday from 10:00am-11:00am.
Free beginner ukulele lessons from 11:00am-12:00pm. Just bring your own ukulele and join the fun! 
www.konainternationalmarket.com or contact Kay Lund at: 808-329-6262 or email her at: Kay@Luhia.com
